zone.line: Of Heaven descends upon a land like thee
Thy mountains, seas & vineyards & the towers
Of cities they encircle — it was ours
To stand on thee beholding it; & then,
Just as we had dismounted, the Count's men
Were waiting for us with the Gondola —
As those who pause on some delightful way
Tho' bent on pleasant pilgrimage, we stood
Looking upon the evening & the flood
Which lay between the city and the shore
Paved with the image of the sky — the hour
And aery Alps towards the north appeared
Between the East & West; & half the sky
Was roofed with clouds of rich emblazonry.
